snippet: The deaths signal a shift in tactics by the radical Islamists who have been battling the Nigerian government for nearly four years in the country’s impoverished north.
abstract: Radical islamists in northern Nigeria kill seven foreign construction workers who were kidnapped in February, significant escalation of extremist violence in country's continuing jihadist insurgency.
lead_paragraph: The deaths signal a shift in tactics by the radical Islamists who have been battling the Nigerian government for nearly four years in the country’s impoverished north.

headline.seo: Islamists Kill 7 Captives in Nigeria, a Shift in Tactics
